alert.note: Alert for Hoopa; Lower Middle Klamath; North Coast; Trinity; Upper Smith; Van Duzen, Mad River (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 24 at 7:39AM PDT until August 25 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WITH ABUNDANT LIGHTNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT... .An upper level disturbance will aid in scattered thunderstorm development this afternoon and night across portions of Trinity, Del Norte, Humboldt, and western Siskiyou Counties. Thunderstorms will be moving to the north-northwest at a rapid speed resulting in only light rainfall totals. The threat for fire starts will be elevated as a result. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 2 AM PDT FRIDAY... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 201, 203, 204, 211, 212, and 283. This includes the communities of Crescent City, Gasquet, Klamath, Orick, Orleans, Hoopa, Willow Creek, Dinsmore, and Hyampom. * THUNDERSTORMS...Scattered thunderstorms with abundant lightning developing Thursday afternoon and night, moving north to northwest from Trinity County into northern Humboldt, western Siskiyou, and Del Norte counties. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Erratic outflow wind gusts up to 40 mph. * IMPACTS...Increased threat of fire starts and erratic fire behavior due to gusty outflow winds.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Hoopa; Lower Middle Klamath; North Coast; Trinity; Upper Smith; Van Duzen, Mad River
